full_text:
LAW OFFICE OF GUY FRONSTIN
515 N. FLAGLER DRIVE, SUITE 300 PAVILION
WEST PALM BEACH, FL 33401
(561) 447-4011 * (561) 802-4121 (Fax)

SENT VIA HAND DELIVERY

February 17, 2006

Lanna Belohlavek
Assistant State Attorney
Office of the State Attorney
401 N. Dixie Highway
West Palm Beach, FL 33401

Re: Jeffrey Epstein

Dear Lanna:

Thank you for meeting yesterday and allowing Alan and me to address your investigation of Jeffrey Epstein. Pursuant to our discussion, I am enclosing an Incident Report from Victoria Secret outlining three (3) recent incidents of theft committed by [REDACTED].

I am submitting this Incident Report with the express understanding that it will be kept in strict confidence. Specifically, since the Report only concerns [REDACTED], I believe there is no good faith reason, in any contact you may have with the store to mention Mr. Epstein's name or the investigation (especially in light of reports from multiple witnesses indicating Detective Recarey is providing damaging mis-information). Please let me know if you have any questions about the report and I will do whatever I can to immediately resolve your concerns.

Additionally, I am enclosing a credit card receipt (with non-relevant information redacted) confirming the purchase of the strap-on dildo that [REDACTED] purchased at Guys and Dolls. It will make clear that when the dildo was purchased [REDACTED] was over 18 years old and she charged the purchase on Nadia Marcinkova's credit card. Ms. Marcinkova had never before been to Guys and Dolls and was taken there by [REDACTED] who indicated it was her favorite sex shop.

07/26/17 Page 45 of 131 Public Records Request No.: 17-295 DOJ-OGR-00030512

additional_notes: The document appears to be a letter from Guy Fronstin's law office to Lanna Belohlavek regarding Jeffrey Epstein. There are several redactions in the text, likely to protect sensitive information. The document is part of a public records request.
